sen.j: 天孫族（てんそんぞく）とは、記紀に登場し日本神話に語り継がれるヤマト王権をつくったとする古代勢力の総称。
sen.e: The Tenson-zoku (Tenson tribe) is a generic term for ancient powers that established the Yamato Dynasty, which appears in the Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters) and the Nihonshoki (The Chronicles of Japan) and which is told in Japanese mythology.

The Tenson-zoku (Tenson tribe) is a generic term for ancient powers that established the Yamato Dynasty, which appears in the Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters) and the Nihonshoki (The Chronicles of Japan) and which is told in Japanese mythology.

The Tenson-zoku (Tenson tribe) is a generic term for ancient powers that established the Yamato Dynasty, which appears in the Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters) and the Nihonshoki (The Chronicles of Japan) and which is told in Japanese mythology.

sen.j: 「新撰姓氏録」では、天火明命の子孫を『天孫』と定義している。
sen.e: 'The Shinsen Shojiroku' (New Selection and Record of Hereditary Titles and Family Names) defines "Tenson" as the offspring of Ame no Hoakari, a deity in Japanese myths.
'The Shinsen Shojiroku' (New Selection and Record of Hereditary Titles and Family Names) defines "Tenson" as the offspring of Ame no Hoakari, a deity in Japanese myths.
'The Shinsen Shojiroku' (New Selection and Record of Hereditary Titles and Family Names) defines "Tenson" as the offspring of Ame no Hoakari, a deity in Japanese myths.

sen.j: 天皇家や物部氏、隼人はその子孫にあたるとしている。
sen.e: It mentions that the Imperial Family, the Mononobe clan and an ancient tribe of Hayato descended from the Tenson tribe.
It mentions that the Imperial Family, the Mononobe clan and an ancient tribe of Hayato descended from the Tenson tribe.
It mentions that the Imperial Family, the Mononobe clan and an ancient tribe of Hayato descended from the Tenson tribe.

sen.j: 高天原より葦原中国平定のため九州地方に天孫降臨した。
sen.e: The Tenson tribe descended from heaven to conquer Ashihara no nakakuni (literally, the Central Land of Reed Plains) in Kyushu region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Tenson tribe descended from heaven to conquer Ashihara no nakakuni (literally, the Central Land of Reed Plains) in Kyushu region.
The Tenson tribe descended from heaven to conquer Ashihara no nakakuni (literally, the Central Land of Reed Plains) in Kyushu region.

sen.j: 中国地方を経て近畿地方まで神武東征した。
sen.e: Led by Emperor Jinmu they advanced east through Chugoku region to Kinki region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Led by Emperor Jinmu they advanced east through Chugoku region to Kinki region.
Led by Emperor Jinmu they advanced east through Chugoku region to Kinki region.

sen.j: 西日本各地の豪族を従え大王 (ヤマト王権)（天皇）を中心とするヤマト王権（倭国）を樹立した。
sen.e: Vanquishing the ruling families across western Japan they established the Yamato dynasty (Wakoku) which was ruled by the Great King of Yamato (emperor).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Vanquishing the ruling families across western Japan they established the Yamato dynasty (Wakoku) which was ruled by the Great King of Yamato (emperor).
Vanquishing the ruling families across western Japan they established the Yamato dynasty (Wakoku) which was ruled by the Great King of Yamato (emperor).

sen.j: 中部・関東地方まで勢力を拡大させ、のちの日本へと発展していったとしている。
sen.e: The dynasty expanded its power to Chubu and Kanto regions and developed into Japan as we know it today.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The dynasty expanded its power to Chubu and Kanto regions and developed into Japan as we know it today.
